div.head: Thomas King Will
div.p:
1st In the name of God Amen. I Thomas King of Charles County
in the province of Maryland being very sick and weake in body but blessed
be the Lord having my perfect sence and memory doe make here my
last will and testament. First I do give and bequeath unto Almighty my
soule that made it and my body to a Christian burial and all my wordly
goods as followeth after my Debts be satisfied.

2nd I doe give and bequeath unto my wifes Eldest D after Elizabeth Johnes two
mares and four caves.

3rd I doe give unto my wives onee Philip Johnes one mare filly about two
4 years of age 4 by I doe bequeath unto Mary Rider and Susana
Fogg the D of my Deceased sister Susana Fogg wife of David Fogg
twenty and five acres of Land now in the hand and possession of Margaret
Cutter with all the rights and priviledges there and belonging unto the
said Mary and Susana and there heirs forever and also my brother
David Fogg to be their gardian untill they be married or sixteen years
years of age and if in case one of them should dye without heirs that
then it is to fall to their cosen Elizabeth Johnes and her heirs.

5 I doe give and bequeath unto my child my wife goeth with now my
will at nonsingy and ten caves also and in case the child shall come to
life twelve years of age that therein the child lad or mayde shall have the
the full disporsing of the will and cattle also whatsoever falleth to my wife
after Leggasies givwn and debts paid in case my wife deith before my
Child be twelve years ould that what falleth to her then shall be given
to the aforesaid child at twelve years of age for its desposiall and in care
my wife shall live tillafter the child be twelve years of age that she
shall then enjoy what falleth to her her life time and after my wife
J - Decease that then what belongeth to her shall fall to my
wifes
wifes three children I doe give also to George Nueman Senior six
Barells of corn and Last I doe give John Wheeler of Nonounoie
three hundred pounds of Tobacco to be the year next insuing and to
the primises above given and mentioned I have hereunto set
my hand and seal the 17th day of January and in the y year
of our Lord 1677. Signed Sealed and delivered in presense of us
it is to be understood that the Land given to my sister Susanas
children my wife Johanath King is to enjoy it for four years
after the day and date hereof and then to fall and be delivered unto
my brother David Fogg as gardian unto the children aforesaid

Signed Sealed and Delivered
In presence of
John Douglass - Richard Edeling
Thomas King
signn

On he back of the aforegoing will was endorsed the foll. probate to will,
August 15th 1678. There was the within written will proved
in common form by the oaths of John Douglass and Richard Edeling
before me commissioned thereto
5 1/4 sides
Benjamin Rozer
